metadata.title: CVE-2014-1938 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
python-rply before 0.7.4 insecurely creates temporary files.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1938` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

pypy-rply - 0.7.4-1
python-rply - 0.7.4-1
python3-rply - 0.7.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python-rply package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.7.4-1').
